Title: Procurement Executive/ Purchasing Executive - Chuyên Viên Mua Hàng/ Thu Mua
Location: Khu công nghiệp Mỹ Xuân A, Phường Phú Mỹ, TP Hồ Chí Minh, Dương Xá, Gia Lâm, Hanoi, Vietnam
Job Description:
Hiring position: Procurement Senior Executive

Role Objective:

• Oversee the procurement team and all plant-level procurement activities, ensuring accuracy and
compliance with company policies
• Optimize existing suppliers in the vendor pool while promoting strategic partnerships and
developing new sourcing channels to foster competition
• Manage supplier selection, negotiations, and ensure timely delivery of goods and services at
competitive prices
• Identify and drive cost-saving initiatives to enhance efficiency and reduce expenses
• Build and maintain strong vendor relationships, leveraging supplier capabilities for strategic
advantage
• Analyze and staying up-to-date on market trends


Duties & Responsibilities:

1. Sourcing & Supplier Management
• Source, evaluate, and develop suppliers to meet quality, cost, and delivery targets and stable supply
• Negotiate contracts and pricing to achieve favorable terms and conditions
• Monitor supplier performance and drive continuous improvement
• Maintain and manage supplier databases for accuracy and efficiency
2. Procurement Operations
• Supervise daily procurement operations, ensuring full compliance with internal policies and procedures
• Review and approve purchase orders for accuracy and alignment with budget and
operational needs
• Collaborate cross-functionally with planning, production, and finance to support business requirements and resolve procurement issues
• Define and track supplier performance metrics to ensure quality and reliability
• Manage requisition processes and maintain accurate documentation
• Lead and manage the procurement team: assign tasks, monitor performance, and ensure delivery against function KPIs (savings, OTIF, and PPM)
• Provide buyer-level support and hands-on assistance when needed
• Deliver training to enhance team capabilities and performance
• Conduct supplier reviews to ensure compliance with company quality standards
• Perform additional tasks as assigned by management
3. Cost Control & Risk Management
• Analyze market trends and cost drivers to identify savings opportunities
• Mitigate supply chain risks through proactive planning and supplier diversification
• Track and control procurement costs to ensure budget alignment
• Recommend process enhancements and cost optimization initiatives to improve efficiency
4. Team Leadership
• Lead and supervise buyers, assign tasks and provide clear direction to the procurement team
• Coach and develop team members to enhance skills and performance
• Cultivate a culture of accountability, collaboration, and continuous improvement
5. Reporting & Analytics
• Generate and analyze procurement reports and KPIs (cost savings, OTIF, PPM, supplier performance)
• Leverage data insights to support strategic decision-making and procurement planning.
Job Requirements:
1. Key Skills & Competencies
• Work experience in relevant product industries or related fields, with awareness of industry trends and market dynamics
• Good communication and negotiation skills to build effective cross-functional and supplier relationships
• Uphold high professional ethics and integrity; show passion, creativity, resilience, and a proactive attitude toward challenges
• Exhibit strong data sensitivity and analytical skills to support informed decision-making
• Apply deep knowledge of procurement best practices, sourcing strategies, and supply chain principles
• Proficient in ERP systems including SAP, Ariba, and Google tools
• Strong problem-solving abilities and a results-driven mindset
• Proven leadership and team development capabilities
• Effective coaching & interpersonal influence
2. Qualifications & Experience
• Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, Business Administration, or a related field
• Minimum 3–5 years of experience in procurement, sourcing, or supply chain, including at least 1–2 years in a supervisory role
• Must be fluent in English, both written and spoken

Title: Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist (Supply Chain Management System) - 750M ~ 1.2B Vnd/year
Location: Quận 1, TP. Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam, Tòa nhà Pax Sky, 63-65 Phố Ngô Thì Nhậm, Phường Phạm Đình Hổ, Quận Hai Bà Trưng, TP Hà Nội, Tầng 1, Pax Sky, 63-65 Ngô Thì Nhậm, Phường Phạm Đình Hổ, Quận Hai Bà Trưng, TP Hà Nội, Việt Nam
Job Description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Crossian is a high-growth technology-driven e-commerce business. Behind our success is our people. As a start-up formed in 2020, we have created a fast-paced and dynamic environment, enabling our people to reach a cumulative average growth rate of over 1000% in the last 3 years. Our mission now is to build direct-to-consumer brands and increase customer lifetime value.
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist with expertise in headhunting to lead our recruitment initiatives and drive strategic hiring decisions. In this role, you will take ownership of identifying, engaging, and onboarding top-tier talent to meet our business needs. You will work closely with leadership teams to attract high-caliber professionals, leveraging your networking and headhunting skills to ensure the acquisition of the best candidates in the market.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Talent Acquisition Strategy
• Develop and implement effective recruitment strategies to attract top talent across various channels, including job boards, social media, and professional networks.
• Partner with business leaders to identify hiring needs and create tailored talent acquisition plans.
Headhunting and Sourcing
• Proactively identify, approach, and engage passive candidates through innovative sourcing techniques and headhunting strategies.
• Build and maintain a strong pipeline of qualified candidates for critical and high-level positions.
• Specialize in recruiting for roles in the apparel industry and/or supply chain management system functions.
Candidate Management
• Screen, interview, and evaluate candidates to ensure they align with role requirements and company values.
• Guide candidates through the recruitment process, providing an exceptional candidate experience.
Stakeholder Collaboration
• Act as a trusted advisor to hiring managers, offering insights on market trends, talent availability, and competitive salary benchmarks.
• Work closely with HR teams to align recruitment efforts with organizational goals.
Recruitment Analytics
• Monitor and report on recruitment metrics to measure the effectiveness of hiring strategies.
• Continuously refine processes to improve efficiency and quality of hires.
Employer Branding
Enhance the company's employer brand by representing the organization at industry events, career fairs, and on digital platforms.
Job Requirements:
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
• At least 5 years experience in recruiting function, proven experience in senior talent acquisition, including headhunting for senior-level roles.
• Demonstrable success in recruiting for roles within the apparel industry and/or supply chain functions (e.g., quality inspectors, technical designers, sourcing specialists, production managers).
• Experience with specialized sourcing for apparel industry talent and supply chain management system professionals.
• Strong networking skills and a demonstrated ability to engage passive candidates.
• Strong command in English to approach and acquire global talents
• Be proactive, possess "can do" attitude plus strong analytical skills, and able to work under pressure in dealing with demands and priorities with positive
• Possess strong interpersonal, planning, leadership, decision-making, and communication skills
• Personality: Quick-thinker, intelligent, and straightforward communicator who can deliver information clearly and concisely without unnecessary elaboration.
• Ability to quickly understand technical requirements for apparel and supply chain roles to effectively evaluate candidate fit

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT
At Crossian, our people are the key to our success. We believe in creating an attractive total compensation package that not only retains employees but allows them to excel in their profession. These include:
• Total Compensation Package (750M - 1.2B VND per year)
• Monthly Salary Range: 25-40M VND (depending on experience)
• Bonuses: Average 18 months performance and annual bonuses per year
• Full salary during probation
• Global health insurance, Training & Development budget, Team building budget, 5-star company events, 12 days Work-from-home allowance & much more.
• Other benefits in accordance with the Company's Policy and Vietnam Labor Law.

Title: Senior C&B Specialist (Up to 30 Months Of Annual Salary)
Location: Tầng 1, Pax Sky, 63-65 Ngô Thì Nhậm, Phường Phạm Đình Hổ, Quận Hai Bà Trưng, TP Hà Nội, Việt Nam, Tầng 5, Pax Sky, 63-65 Ngô Thì Nhậm, Phường Phạm Đình Hổ, Quận Hai Bà Trưng, TP Hà Nội, Việt Nam
Job Description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Crossian is a high-growth technology-driven e-commerce business. Behind our success is our people. As a start-up formed in 2020, we have created a fast-paced and dynamic environment, enabling our people to reach a cumulative average growth rate of over 900% in the last 3 years. Our mission now is to build direct-to-consumer brands and increase customer LTV.

As a Senior C&B Specialist, your challenge is to lead the compensation and benefits program’s continuous improvement initiatives under our People Operations & Empowerment (POE) group. You will work with upper management and leadership to develop and implement top notch packages for our People backed by data-driven industry insights. You will be in charge of operating and controlling all day-to-day C&B activities. You will also be expected to develop and generate reports to measure the success of People Retention programs under C&B.

This role is perfect for you if you are a self-starter, have proven experience in implementing top notch C&B programs, and you have a relentless drive to improve People welfare. This position offers a promising and rewarding career path for individuals who can challenge the status quo and are driven to impact the organization’s processes and efficiencies.

WHAT YOU WILL DO
- Operate and control all C&B activities in payroll, PIT, insurance, labor contracts, policies, benefits, timesheets, internal & external labor reports for local & expat staff
- Initiate and implement C&B Policies, Reward & Recognition Programs, Loyalty Schemes, Health Care
- Survey, update C&B market trend to provide high standard and modern perks and benefits programs
- Set up and organize annual salary review, performance evaluation, promotion programs, etc.
- Compute monthly payroll, Personal Income Tax, staff allowances and bonus in accordance with company policies
- Give advice to employees and stakeholders about labor laws, company policies, regulations & practices to ensure compliance
- Make monthly/periodic internal payroll report/ costing report, PIT report and other statutory reports for relevant authorities
- Handle People Ops benefits administration including self-insured, group life, medical insurance as well as expatriate, partner & directors benefits administration
- Manage and administer People Ops management system & labor contract practices
Job Requirements:
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
- Bachelor or above degree
- At least 3 years of experience in C&B
- Detail-oriented and highly focused professional with effective written and verbal communication skills (English equivalent to IELTS 6++ or TOEIC 800++)
- Experience in Technology/ E-commerce/ international companies is an advantage

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT
At Crossian, our people are the key to our success. We believe in creating an attractive total compensation package (TCP) that not only retains employees but allows them to excel in their profession. These include:
- Competitive gross salary, open for discussion
- Full salary during probation
- Guaranteed 13th month salary
- Quarterly bonus & Year-end bonus as part of our profit sharing program
- 12 days work-from-home & 12 days of paid annual leave
- Global health insurance package for yourself and direct family members
- A Pantry & a Crossian Cafe stocked with goodies, ready to serve
- Lots of other company benefits including 5-star annual company trip, budget for frequent team building activities and other monthly / quarterly / annual company events
- General company T&D Program + dedicated T&D budget for managers
- Other benefits in accordance to Company's Policy and Vietnam Labor Laws

Title: Chuyên Gia Quản Lý Rủi Ro Công Nghệ Thông Tin
Company: Ngân Hàng Thương Mại Cổ Phần Thịnh Vượng Và Phát Triển (PGBANK)
Location: Tầng 4,5,6 tòa nhà Thành Công, Ô đất P - D17 Khu đô thị Cầu Giấy; phường Dịch Vọng Hậu; quận Cầu Giấy; thành phố Hà Nội,, Tầng 24, Tòa tháp văn phòng Mipec, 229 Tây Sơn, Đống Đa, Hà Nội
Job Description:
• Xây dựng, triển khai khung, chính sách, quy định nội bộ về quản lý rủi ro trong lĩnh vực CNTT, rà soát, đề xuất cải tiến quy định quản lý rủi ro CNTT, quy trình đánh giá rủi ro CNTT.
• Triển khai kiểm tra nội bộ về công tác bảo đảm an toàn thông tin và kiểm soát rủi ro thất thoát dữ liệu, gian lận truy cập trái phép cho Ngân hàng tuân thủ thông tư 09/2020/TT-NHNN.
• Chịu trách nhiệm tổng thể đánh giá rủi ro an ninh thông tin và lộ trình kiểm soát rủi ro an ninh thông tin chung của ngân hàng phù hợp với chiến lược kinh doanh chung;
• Phối hợp cùng đơn vị đánh giá rủi ro và tác động của việc gián đoạn hệ thống thông tin.
• Rà soát, đánh giá lại bộ phân quyền truy cập hệ thống thông tin định kỳ hàng năm, tư vấn, đánh giá phân quyền ngoại lệ.
• Triển khai đánh giá tác động xử lý dữ liệu cá nhân theo yêu cầu của Bộ Công An để tuân thủ NĐ13/2023/NĐ-CP về bảo vệ dữ liệu cá nhân.
• Đánh giá rủi ro, triển khai giải pháp phòng chống thất thoát dữ liệu (“DLP”)
• Tư vấn và tham gia triển khai áp dụng các tiêu chuẩn ISO, PCIDSS, COBIT, ITIL, SWIFT áp dụng đối với hệ thống CNTT
• Phân tích, báo cáo sự cố CNTT
• Tham gia đánh giá rủi ro dự án CNTT, là đầu mối kiểm soát độc lập tham gia trong quá trình IT triển khai các dự án đảm bảo an ninh bảo mật, xây dựng và rà soát phân quyền hệ thống, đảm bảo từ thiết kế hệ thống đến khi dự án hoàn thành hoàn thành đúng với mục đích, yêu cầu tuân thủ các Quy định nội bộ và quy định PL về ATTT.
• Giám sát, đo lường các chỉ số rủi ro chính (KRI) công nghệ thông tin
• Đánh giá rủi ro dịch vụ CNTT của nhà cung cấp và bên thứ ba
• Đánh giá rủi ro các hệ thống ứng dụng, cơ sở hạ tầng
• Đánh giá rủi ro về các mảng lưu trữ dữ liệu/ kiến trúc mạng/an ninh mạng
• Đánh giá rủi ro quản lý vòng đời phát triển phần mềm và dữ liệu
• Đánh giá rủi ro, cập nhật công nghệ mới và thách thức đối với các công nghệ mới (Azure, AWS, GCP, ZTNA, CASB
• Thực hiện các nhiệm vụ theo phân công của GĐK, GĐP
Job Requirements:
- Tối thiểu 3 năm kinh nghiệm làm việc ở cùng vị trí.
- Tối thiểu 3 năm kinh nghiệm làm việc ở cùng vị trí, am hiểu trong công nghệ an toàn bảo mật
- Ưu tiên có kinh nghiệm tham gia giám sát, quản lý rủi ro các quy trình CNTT/ ATTT, kinh nghiệm quản lý rủi ro, an toàn dữ liệu, bảo mật dữ liệu
- Hiểu biết về kiến trúc mạng, bảo mật.
- Hiểu biết về các mô hình quản lý rủi ro ANTT trên thế giới (NIST, MITRE...)
- Hiểu biết về tiêu chuẩn an toàn, bảo mật của ngành: PCI-DSS, ISO 27001:2013, COBIT, khuôn khổ an ninh mạng NIST, FFIEC, v.v.
- Hiểu biết về tiêu chuẩn quản lý dịch IT ITIL
- Hiểu biết về chính sách tuân thủ trong ngành ngân hàng (TT09, TT47, TT35)
- Hiểu biết chuyên sâu về các hình thức tấn công an ninh mạng và biện pháp phòng chống…
- Hiểu biết về đánh giá theo quy trình độc lập kiểm thử hạ tầng CNTT, các dịch vụ ứng dụng web app, mobile app, API ứng dụng và hạ tầng Cloud.
- Hiểu biết về phương pháp đánh giá rủi ro cho quy trình nghiệp vụ ứng dụng dựa theo Threat Model
- Hiểu biết về bảo mật an toàn cơ sở dữ liệu, các thông tin quan trọng của doanh nghiệp và thông tin người dùng, giúp hệ thống hoạt động ổn định
- Hiểu biết về các sản phẩm và giải pháp: Cisco, Checkpoint, Windows, Linux, Vulnerability scanning, Endpoint Security, DLP, SIEM, PIM,...Azure, AWS, GCP
- Có khả năng phân tích, tổng hợp tốt.
- Khả năng phối hợp và làm việc theo nhóm tốt.
- Tiếng Anh Nghe, Nói, Đọc, Viết tốt là một lợi thế.
- Chứng chỉ: Có chứng chỉ về ISO27001, ISO27005, CRISC, CGRC, CISA, CISM, CISSP, CEH, CCSP là lợi thế

- Bachelor degree.

- Knowledgeable in local practices and policies for recruitment and employment.
- Extensive interviewing skills and the ability to develop others to interview well.
- Must have a through knowledge of recruitment and selection techniques.
- Significant experience in hiring & selection of levels, having good network and connection in hospitality manning resources.

- Ability to communicate fluently in English both oral and written.
- Exceptional and professional communication skills, both oral and written, especially in negotiating and presentation
- Capacity to foster productive relations with peers and assure teamwork is the prevailing way to do business.
- Well organized, multitask, detail oriented, problem solving.
- Ability to act and understand a sense of urgency. Excellent guest service skills.

Title: Sales Representative (Healthcare)
Location: 5th floor - UOA building – 06 Tan Trao, Tan My, HCM, 40 Phố Cát Linh, Cát Linh, Đống Đa, Hà Nội, Việt Nam, Đà Nẵng, Việt Nam, Thanh Oai Industrial Complex, Thanh Oai Dist, Hanoi, Vietnam
Job Description:
Are you a (Senior) Sales Representative passionate about sales operations & efficiency in healthcare industry? If so, this opportunity could be for you! Join us at B. Braun, a leader in the medical devices industry, where your skills and experience will be recognized and celebrated. Take the next step in your career with us and help shape the future of healthcare!

As a (Senior) Sales Representative at B. Braun, you will play a vital role in promoting and selling in-charged products (medical equipment and/or devices focusing on endoscopy and surgical technologies) to hospitals and healthcare professionals within ETC channel. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving sales growth, building strong relationships with healthcare professionals, and expanding our market presence while fully adhering to regulatory standards, company policies in all interactions and activities.

1) Sales and business development:
1.1) Create and implement effective sales plan to achieve sales targets for assigned product ranges. Based on the historical sales and analysis of actual situation of market, propose sales forecast to (direct) manager(s) in order to have sufficient stock for sales and further sales forecast and tracking.
1.2) Meet or exceed sales targets by promoting and selling products to hospitals and healthcare professionals as well as managing well the relationship with distributors/ dealers.
1.3) Conduct product presentations and demonstrations to highlight the benefits and usage of products to hospital-based healthcare staff.
1.4) Keep updated of progress and development in the market and at customers in charge to identify and establish new business opportunities.
2) Customer engagement :
2.1) Maintain frequent visit to customers
2.2) Establish and maintain strong relationships with key opinion leaders, influencers (KOLs) at customer sides, and hospital procurement departments.
2.2) Provide ongoing support to customers, addressing their needs and resolving any issues related to product usage or delivery.
2.3) Gather and report customer feedback to improve product offerings and customer satisfaction.
2.4) Find out customer insights and needs through daily conversation and observation to propose business opportunities as a trusted partner.
2.5) Act as first point of contact to handle customer complaints to ensure customer satisfaction/ understanding and compliance. Coordinate with technical team to ensure flawless execution for machine installation, training and after-sales services.
3) Tender management:
3.1) Combine customer understanding, regulatory and economic landscape to identify potental investment and purchase opportunities of customers.
3.2) Ensure B.Braun's products are listed in hospital tenders by meeting all necessary criteria and deadlines.
3.3) Monitor the performance of submitted tenders and manage any issues that arise during the tender process.
3.4) Work closely with CSR team and dealers/ distributors who handle the preparation of tender documents to ensure all requirements are met.
4) Products configuration:
4.1) Maintain in-depth knowledge of B.Braun's product portfolio and therapies then work with healthcare professionals to understand their specific needs and requirements for the assigned products.
4.2) Configure and customize products to meet the specific needs of hospitals and departments. Act as the partner of customers and utilise product understanding to provide consultancy and increase advocacy of customers in charge to B. Braun products.
5) Report, analysis and others :
5.1) Report sales performance, customer interactions, market intelligence, competitor activities, etc on designed CRM system or as per requested.
5.2) Build-up the relationship with dealers across the assigned region.
5.3) Collaborate effectively with other teams when required for aligned actions and support including but not limited to events, customer survey...
5.4) Fulfill other tasks as assigned by (direct) managers from time to time.
Job Requirements:
• Graduated from University, major in Medicine & Pharmacy/Biomedical/Biotechnology
• At least 2-year experience of working as Sales Representative in pharmaceutical or medical device
• Experience in tender management
• Willing go to business trip in provinces
• Good selling skill and able to deal with customers. Good product knowledge (after being trained)
• Excellent communication skill; good analytical and planning skill.
• Able to work in team or work individually, good networking skill
• Hardworking, patient & self - motivated, high sense of responsibility, confident. Commercial and business awareness

Title: Conversational AI Specialist
Location: Havanna Tower, Hàm Nghi, Bến Thành, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, Havana Tower, 132, Ham Nghi Str., Ben Thanh Ward, Dist. 1, HCMC
Job Description:
Trusting Social is an AI Fintech pioneer that's revolutionizing credit access in emerging markets. Our mission is "Advancing AI to Meet the Financial Needs of Everyday Consumers with Empathy." We've assessed over 1 billion consumers across four countries, and we're on a mission to provide 100 million credit lines using the power of AI and Big Data.

How You'll Make an Impact
We are seeking a highly data-driven and results-oriented Conversational AI Specialist to lead the design, optimization, and continuous improvement of our AI-powered conversational agents. This role is ideal for someone with a proven track record in telesales/sales, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to translate winning sales strategies into structured conversational flows for AI.

What You'll Do

Design Conversational Flows:
- Build detailed workflow and script flows for Conversational AI Agents across multiple use cases, with a primary focus on:
Credit card acquisition
Unsecured Personal Loan acquisition
Credit card activation and spending promotion
Customer engagement and retention
- Ensure scripts reflect high-EQ communication, persuasive language, and compliance with regulations.

AI Agent Optimization:
- Launch flows across channels (outbound/inbound voice, chat/web/app) and orchestrate A/B tests on openings, hooks, offers, and closings.
- Monitor funnel analytics (contactability → qualification → approval → activation → first‑spend), containment rate, FCR, AHT, CSAT/NPS.
- Drive systematic optimization (hypothesis → experiment → analysis → iterate) to improve conversion and customer experience.
- Establish quality standards and an evaluation framework (call scoring, error taxonomy, hallucination/guardrail checks, compliance audits).

Sales Strategy Research & Integration:
- Continuously research top‑performing sales methods (scripts, talk tracks, tone, timing, objections, offers) from frontline teams and external benchmarks.
- Distill insights into playbooks and reusable prompt patterns the AI can learn from; maintain a versioned knowledge base.
- Coach internal teams on how to brief, test, and improve Conversational AI agents.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:
- Work closely with product, engineering, and analytics teams to ensure Conversational AI design is aligned with business goals.
- Collaborate with compliance and quality assurance teams to ensure adherence to guidelines.
Job Requirements:
Must-Have:
- 2+ years as a top‑performing telesales/sales rep (e.g., top 5–10% by conversion/revenue) with proven objection‑handling and closing skills.
- High EQ: reads customer signals, adapts tone, de‑escalates, and builds trust quickly.
- Exceptional language ability (clear, concise, persuasive; excellent grammar and micro‑copy).
- Strong logical thinking and the ability to formalize messy sales know‑how into structured flows, rules, variables, and templates.
- Demonstrated a learn‑fast attitude and optimization mindset (A/B testing, data‑driven iteration).
- Product ownership fundamentals: writing crisp user stories/AC, prioritization, stakeholder alignment, UAT, and go‑live readiness.

Nice-to-Have:
- Familiarity with Conversational AI platforms or chatbot frameworks.
- Knowledge of customer journey design and sales funnel optimization.

Title: Supplier Quality Engineer (Mechanical and EE)
Location: Hải Phòng, Việt Nam, Vung Ang, Ha Tinh, Symphony Building, Chu Huy Man Street, Hanoi, Vietnam
Job Description:
RESPONSILITIES - For New Product and Current Series activities:
• Supplier assessment (PSA) for supplier selection process.
• Lead the APQP activities with an international supply base
• Clarification of engineering changes.
• Creation and alignment of the production part approval process (PPAP) per the VinFast and AIAG guidelines.
• Control all phases of project through CAE, Design, Construction, and Tryout.
• Coordination of cross-functional teams to achieve quality and program objectives
• Report part readiness for launch to management team
• Fixture & gauge concept and capability validation
• Specialist for production issues
• Provide lessons learned from current running series to improve future projects.
• Manage international production part suppliers in regards to quality concerns and change implementation. This includes communicating all part issues and coordinating countermeasure activities.
• Execute the Supplier Quality activities from concept through launch and the customer ownership experience
• Ensure that all programs meet the three measures of a successful vehicle launch: on time, excellent quality and meeting and/or exceeding program financial targets.
Job Requirements:
• Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Experience: A minimum of 4 years of experience in Quality or Engineering within Original Equipment Manufacturing or a Tier 1 Supplier
• Basic exposure to Automotive Quality Systems such as ISO 9001, IATF 16949
Necessary Skills, Certifications, etc.:
• Strong planning, organization and problem skills required using established methodologies
• Strong communication skills with special focus on Supplier Relationship management and handling are required, as well the ability to communicate complex topics into a cross-functional and cross-cultural environment
• Team player who can work with multiple stakeholders internally and externally
• Capable of using hand measurement tools (i.e., calipers, micro-meters) PPAP and audit experience
• Working knowledge in Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) and Failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA)
• Fluent English is a must
• Can-do attitude and the courage to take risk-based decisions

Title: Frontline Officer
Location: Hồ Chí Minh, Việt Nam, 250 Collins Street, Melbourne, 3000
Job Description:
About Us
We are a forward-thinking organisation passionate about innovation, growth, and creating lasting impact. As we expand our presence, we’re seeking a dynamic Frontline Officer to join our team and play a key role in supporting our students and prospective learners.

Position Overview
The Frontline Officer is a customer-facing role responsible for delivering high-quality administrative support and ensuring an exceptional experience for prospective and current students through our digital channels. Acting as the first point of contact, this role plays a key part in guiding students through enquiries, applications, and enrolments, while maintaining strong relationships and accurate records.

Key Duties & Responsibilities

Respond promptly to student and prospect enquiries, primarily via live chat and email, by sourcing information, following up, and providing clear, timely responses.

Build rapport and establish trust with prospective students and customers.

Serve as the primary contact point for leads and prospective students on queries including course details, fees, and the application process.

Assist with student enrolment, providing support and follow-up until conversion.

Maintain accurate records of leads and new submissions in the system.

Direct current student enquiries to the appropriate team or department for resolution.
Job Requirements:
Requirements & Skills
Previous experience in a customer service, student support, or administrative role (education sector experience is highly desirable).

Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey information clearly and professionally.

Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport and engage with diverse audiences.

Strong organisational and time-management abilities, with a keen eye for detail.

Proficiency in digital tools, CRM systems, and Microsoft Office Suite (experience with student management systems is an advantage).

Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

A proactive, problem-solving mindset with a strong focus on delivering exceptional service.

Flexibility, adaptability, and a willingness to learn and grow with the organisation.
